item.title: Bags of rubbish left on the street, 19th June
item.description:
There are two or three carrier bags full of rubbish spilling onto the street. And there is a broken branch from a tree lying across the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lucas Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet again household waste has been disposed of up against a treer, 19th June
item.description:
This is really becoming a problem with people disposing of Household items up against one of the trees by the Croxley Green bus shelter going towards Orpington. This is now becoming tedious and unacceptable that people think that is okay to dispose of rubbish it yet again, but this is encouraging vermin and unwanted pests that could cause other damage. This is an ongoing issue that something needs to be done to try and deter this from happening again and again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 87, Midfield Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3-5 inch deep hole, 19th June
item.description:
The tarmac has developed a deep trench andnow a serious risk to pedestrians as trip / fall hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, Avery Hill Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unkempt Garden, 19th June
item.description:
This front garden is full of rubbish, a binder bikes, electrical items, bins and wood. This issue has been present for the last 4 months and now there are rats living in the garden running on the street and into other neighbouring front gardens.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooke Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car left for months, 19th June
item.description:
Hi, This vehicle has been left on the road from the end of last year. The vehicle is untaxed and has not moved for months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdowne Lane, Charlton, London

item.title: 2 beds and matresses dumped on top of a community garden on hook court, 19th June

If not moved asap it will kill the tress and plants and is an eyesore

item.title: Please get someone to cut the very very out grown weeds and excess weeds growing by the block and the park and play area and football pitch, 19th June
item.description:
I have been living here ever since child hood and no one is coming to cut the weeds that are outgrowing from the ground outside peoples doors and the play area and park its just very outgrown making it look and feel unpleasant, we pay council tax for these very reasons and the weeds are not being tended to which is making the area look over crowded with weeds and areas with weeds not being completely cut could someone attend to this area as soon as possible to made adjustments to the weeds by cutting them and making the area look presentable again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bullace Row, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip on land adjacent public alleyway, 19th June
item.description:
See my explanation in the report: Can council officers please assist in this query rather than expect residents of the area to investigate the problem, given that the council will have easy resources to find out, at least, whether this parcel of land is in ownership of Network Rail, or indeed Southeastern railways. I know that it is not in part of 1-9 Apollo Avenue. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hoskins street full of rubbish, 19th June
item.description:
Huskins Street is full of rubbish and it is never picked up. Some of the rubbish seems to be coming from the bakery. There are plastic head covers (blue) and other items used in teh bakery. Additionally a lot of rubbish that was brought by teh wind. Is the street ever cleaned? Shouldn't the bakery clean if some of the rubbish is theirs?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hoskins Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken and tired play equipment, 19th June
item.description:
Clissold playground must be the busiest and worst playground in hackney.. The sandpit is basically dirt. graffiti everywhere. the zip line is broken. the big bucket swing is broken. the spinning cup is broken. the wooden ship stairs are broken
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queen Elizabeths Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle dumped on mini roundabout, 19th June
